label: PostgreSQL
description: Advanced open-source relational database with strong ACID compliance, JSON support, full-text search, and extensions ecosystem. The most popular choice for modern web applications.

label: MySQL
description: Widely-deployed open-source relational database. Fast reads, mature replication, and broad ORM/driver support across all major languages. Owned by Oracle.

label: MariaDB
description: Community-maintained fork of MySQL with additional storage engines, better performance defaults, and fully open-source governance. Drop-in MySQL replacement.

label: SQL Server
description: Microsoft SQL Server — enterprise-grade relational database with T-SQL, integrated analytics, and Windows/AD integration. Requires EULA acceptance.

label: CockroachDB
description: Distributed SQL database designed for horizontal scaling and survivability. PostgreSQL-compatible wire protocol with automatic sharding and multi-region replication.

label: MongoDB
description: Document-oriented NoSQL database storing data as flexible JSON-like BSON documents. Excellent for rapid prototyping and schema-flexible workloads.

label: Cassandra
description: Wide-column distributed database built for massive write throughput and linear horizontal scaling. No single point of failure. Used by Netflix, Apple, and Discord.

label: CouchDB
description: Document database with built-in HTTP API and multi-master replication. Designed for offline-first and sync-heavy applications using CouchDB replication protocol.

label: Neo4j
description: Native graph database for connected data — relationships are first-class citizens. Cypher query language for traversing social networks, knowledge graphs, and recommendations.

label: ArangoDB
description: Multi-model database combining document, graph, and key-value in one engine. Single query language (AQL) across all data models.

label: DynamoDB Local
note: Local dev emulator — no auth needed
description: Local emulator for AWS DynamoDB — key-value and document database. Develop and test DynamoDB-dependent code without AWS credentials or costs.

label: InfluxDB
description: Purpose-built time-series database optimized for high-ingest metrics, IoT sensor data, and real-time analytics. InfluxQL and Flux query languages.

label: ClickHouse
description: Column-oriented OLAP database for real-time analytical queries over billions of rows. Extremely fast aggregations and compression. Created by Yandex.

label: TimescaleDB
description: PostgreSQL extension for time-series data — full SQL support with automatic partitioning (hypertables), continuous aggregates, and compression. Compatible with all PostgreSQL tools.

label: SurrealDB
description: Multi-model cloud-native database combining relational, document, graph, and key-value paradigms with a single query language (SurrealQL). Real-time subscriptions built in.

label: Redis
description: In-memory data store used as cache, message broker, and session store. Sub-millisecond latency with persistence options (RDB snapshots, AOF logs). The industry standard for caching.

label: Valkey
description: Open-source fork of Redis maintained by the Linux Foundation after Redis license change. API-compatible — existing Redis clients and commands work unchanged.

label: KeyDB
description: Multi-threaded Redis-compatible database with higher throughput on multi-core systems. Active replication and MVCC support. Drop-in Redis replacement.

label: Memcached
description: Simple, high-performance distributed memory cache. No persistence — purely in-memory. Best for ephemeral cache layers where simplicity matters more than features.

label: Dragonfly
description: Modern Redis/Memcached-compatible cache with multi-threaded architecture. Handles millions of ops/sec on a single instance. Dramatically lower memory usage than Redis.

label: etcd
description: Distributed key-value store for configuration and service discovery. The coordination backbone of Kubernetes. Strong consistency via Raft consensus.

label: RabbitMQ
description: Feature-rich message broker implementing AMQP, MQTT, and STOMP protocols. Flexible routing, dead-letter exchanges, and built-in management UI. Mature and battle-tested.

label: Kafka (KRaft)
description: Distributed event streaming platform for high-throughput, fault-tolerant pub/sub messaging. KRaft mode eliminates the ZooKeeper dependency. The backbone of event-driven architectures.

label: NATS
description: Lightweight, high-performance messaging system with at-most-once and JetStream (at-least-once) delivery. Extremely low latency and simple to operate.

label: Mosquitto (MQTT)
description: Lightweight MQTT broker for IoT and publish/subscribe messaging. Low resource footprint — ideal for edge devices and sensor networks. Requires custom configuration file.

label: Redpanda
description: Kafka-compatible streaming platform written in C++ — no JVM, no ZooKeeper. Lower latency and simpler operations than Kafka with full API compatibility.

label: ActiveMQ Artemis
description: Apache ActiveMQ Artemis — high-performance, multi-protocol message broker supporting AMQP, MQTT, STOMP, OpenWire, and HornetQ. Enterprise-grade with journal persistence.

label: Celery Worker
description: Python distributed task queue for async background processing. Not a standalone broker — requires Redis or RabbitMQ as the message transport layer.

label: Elasticsearch
description: Distributed search and analytics engine built on Apache Lucene. Full-text search, structured queries, aggregations, and machine learning features. The ELK stack core.

label: OpenSearch
description: Community-driven fork of Elasticsearch (post-license change). Fully compatible APIs with additional security, alerting, and observability plugins. Apache 2.0 licensed.

label: Meilisearch
description: Lightning-fast, typo-tolerant search engine designed for end-user facing search. Simple REST API, instant indexing, and excellent relevance out of the box.

label: Typesense
description: Open-source search engine focused on developer experience — easy to set up, fast typo-tolerant search, and built-in faceting. A simpler Algolia alternative.

label: Apache Solr
description: Enterprise search platform built on Apache Lucene. Mature, feature-rich with faceted search, distributed indexing (SolrCloud), and extensive plugin ecosystem.

label: Nginx
description: High-performance HTTP server, reverse proxy, and load balancer. The most deployed web server worldwide. Requires mounting a custom nginx.conf configuration file.

label: Traefik
description: Cloud-native reverse proxy with automatic service discovery from Docker labels and Kubernetes Ingress. Dynamic configuration — no restarts needed when services change.

label: Caddy
description: Modern web server with automatic HTTPS via Let's Encrypt — zero configuration TLS. Simple Caddyfile syntax for reverse proxy, file serving, and load balancing.

label: HAProxy
description: High-availability TCP/HTTP load balancer and proxy. Industry standard for mission-critical traffic routing with advanced health checking and connection management.

label: Envoy
description: Cloud-native L7 proxy designed for service mesh architectures. Advanced load balancing, observability, and traffic management. The data plane for Istio.

label: Prometheus
description: Pull-based metrics collection and alerting system. Time-series database with PromQL query language. The standard for Kubernetes and cloud-native monitoring.

label: Grafana
description: Visualization and dashboarding platform supporting Prometheus, Loki, Elasticsearch, and 50+ data sources. Build dashboards, set alerts, and explore metrics.

label: Jaeger
note: All-in-one dev image — uses memory storage
description: Distributed tracing backend for monitoring microservice request flows. Visualize latency, find bottlenecks, and trace requests across service boundaries. OpenTelemetry-native.

label: Zipkin
description: Distributed tracing system for gathering timing data across microservices. Simpler than Jaeger with a clean web UI. Supports OpenTelemetry and B3 propagation.

label: OpenTelemetry Collector
description: OpenTelemetry Collector — vendor-neutral telemetry pipeline that receives, processes, and exports traces, metrics, and logs. The standard telemetry gateway.

label: Uptime Kuma
description: Self-hosted uptime monitoring tool with a clean UI. Monitors HTTP, TCP, DNS, and Docker containers. Notifications via Slack, Discord, email, and 90+ integrations.

label: Loki
note: Use with Grafana for log visualization
description: Log aggregation system from Grafana Labs — designed to pair with Grafana. Indexes labels only (not full text), making it cost-efficient for high-volume logs.

label: Fluentd
description: Unified logging layer that collects, transforms, and routes logs from multiple sources to multiple destinations. Extensive plugin ecosystem. CNCF graduated project.

label: Kibana
description: Visualization frontend for Elasticsearch — explore logs, create dashboards, and build search interfaces. Part of the Elastic (ELK) stack. Requires Elasticsearch.

label: Vector
description: High-performance observability data pipeline for logs, metrics, and traces. Written in Rust — very low resource usage. Replaces Logstash, Fluentd, or Filebeat.

label: Seq
description: Structured log server with a powerful query interface for .NET and JSON-based logs. Real-time search, dashboards, and alerting. Requires EULA acceptance.

label: MinIO
description: S3-compatible object storage server. Run AWS S3 APIs locally for development, testing, or production. High-performance distributed storage with erasure coding.

label: SeaweedFS
description: Distributed file system and object store optimized for billions of small files. S3-compatible API with fast lookups. Lighter weight than MinIO for large file counts.

label: Portainer
description: Container management UI for Docker and Kubernetes. Visual dashboard for managing containers, images, networks, and volumes without command-line tools.

label: Vault
description: Secrets management tool by HashiCorp — store, access, and rotate API keys, passwords, certificates, and encryption keys. Dev mode uses in-memory storage.

label: Consul
description: Service discovery, configuration, and service mesh by HashiCorp. DNS and HTTP interfaces for service registration and health checking across distributed systems.

label: Gitea
description: Lightweight self-hosted Git service — a simpler alternative to GitLab. Code hosting, pull requests, issue tracking, and CI/CD webhooks with minimal resource usage.

label: Mailpit
note: Catches all outgoing email — dev/test only
description: Email testing tool that captures all outgoing SMTP email in a web UI. Never accidentally send test emails to real addresses. Development and testing only.

label: Adminer
description: Single-file database management UI supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB, and more. Lightweight alternative to phpMyAdmin with a cleaner interface.

label: pgAdmin 4
description: Full-featured PostgreSQL administration and development platform. Visual query builder, server monitoring, backup/restore, and ERD diagrams.

label: Redis Insight
description: Official Redis GUI for browsing keys, running commands, profiling performance, and debugging. Connects to Redis, Valkey, KeyDB, and any Redis-compatible service.
